aws::graph::propositions: # Aviation Accident Report for Zenith 701 in Eutaw Springs
The accident occurred in Eutaw Springs, South Carolina.
The accident occurred on April 14, 2014, at 18:00 Local time.
The aircraft involved was a KALDOR GREGORY N ZENITH 701.
The defining event of the accident was landing gear collapse.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation - Personal.
The accident number was ERA14CA200.
The aircraft registration was N851RC.
The aircraft sustained substantial damage.
There was 1 person involved in the accident.
No injuries occurred in the accident.
The pilot was flying over a small airstrip near a campground.
The pilot experienced a severe gust of wind.
The severe gust of wind made the airplane turn abruptly to the right.
The pilot felt that the airplane was out of control.
The pilot decided to make a precautionary landing in a plowed field.
During the precautionary landing, the airplane sustained substantial damage to the nose landing gear.
During the precautionary landing, the airplane sustained substantial damage to the wings.
During the precautionary landing, the airplane sustained substantial damage to the fuselage.
The pilot reported no preimpact mechanical malfunctions with the airplane.
The pilot reported no preimpact mechanical failures with the airplane.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of the accident.
The probable cause was the pilot's improper decision to execute a precautionary landing to unsuitable terrain.
The precautionary landing followed an inflight encounter with a wind gust.
The precautionary landing resulted in substantial damage to the airplane.
The accident involved personnel issues related to decision making/judgment by the pilot.
The aircraft was not attained/maintained.
Environmental issues included gusts that affected the operation.
Environmental issues included rough terrain that contributed to the outcome.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
Eutaw Springs, South Carolina

## Date & Time: 
April 14, 2014, 18:00 Local

## Aircraft:
KALDOR GREGORY N ZENITH 701

## Defining Event:
Landing gear collapse

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation - Personal

## Accident Number:
ERA14CA200

## Registration:
N851RC

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
1 None

## Analysis

According to the pilot, he was flying over a small airstrip near a campground when he experienced a severe gust of wind that made the airplane turn abruptly to the right. The pilot felt that the airplane was out of control and decided to make a precautionary landing in a plowed field. During the precautionary landing, the airplane sustained substantial damage to the nose landing gear, wings, and fuselage. The pilot reported no preimpact mechanical malfunctions or failures with the airplane that would have precluded normal operation.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be: The pilot's improper decision to execute a precautionary landing to unsuitable terrain following an inflight encounter with a wind gust, resulting in substantial damage to the airplane.

## Findings

| Personnel issues | Decision making/judgment - Pilot |
| --- | --- |
| Aircraft (general) | Not attained/maintained |
| Environmental issues | Gusts - Effect on operation |
| Environmental issues | Rough terrain - Contributed to outcome |

---
